body:
**Changes by Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)):**

* removed labels: **bug**
* added labels: **task**

**Hong Minhee ([@dahlia](https://github.com/dahlia)) wrote:**

I want to work on this, but I need to ask a question to @zzzeek first: could we introduce [tox][] into Alembic for cross-VM testing?

[tox]: http://tox.testrun.org/

**Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)) wrote:**

using tox just means you have an .ini file there right?   we don't need it for continuous integration, if you see [here](http://jenkins.sqlalchemy.org/) we just have separate jenkins builds per platform.    you can just use the .ini locally ?

**Hong Minhee ([@dahlia](https://github.com/dahlia)) wrote:**

I meant, do you mind if I add `tox.ini` file into the source tree?

**Hong Minhee ([@dahlia](https://github.com/dahlia)) wrote:**

Or should I add `tox.ini` into `.hgignore` list?

**Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)) wrote:**

if/until I totally get into tox for sqlalchemy and everything, put it in .hgignore would be better for now

**Hong Minhee ([@dahlia](https://github.com/dahlia)) wrote:**

Okay, and one more question: SQLAlchemy 0.8 currently supports Python 2.5–3.3, so is it the same for Alembic?

**Hong Minhee ([@dahlia](https://github.com/dahlia)) wrote:**

@zzzeek It currently seems impossible to be parsed on Python 2.5.  Does not Alembic support Python 2.5?

**Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)) wrote:**

lack of 2.5 is not official but that's how it seems, sure.   2.5 is gone very soon in sqlalchemy too (django already dropped 2.5).

**Hong Minhee ([@dahlia](https://github.com/dahlia)) wrote:**

If we don’t need to support 2.5, is there still any reason to use `except Exception: e = sys.exc_info()[1]` instead of simply `except Exception as e:`?

**Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)) wrote:**

no, let's go with 2.6 idioms all the way.  we'll need to add an explicit message to the docs that 2.6 is required.

**Hong Minhee ([@dahlia](https://github.com/dahlia)) wrote:**

I’ve just opened the pull request #34, could you review it?

**Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)) wrote:**

came out great.  thanks a ton !   will call this version 0.6.0.

**Changes by Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)):**

* changed **status** to closed

issue.title: alembic 0.4.2 tests does not pass on python 3.2

repository.name: alembic
repository.description: A database migrations tool for SQLAlchemy.

issue.body:
**Migrated issue, originally created by yaccz ([@yaccz](https://github.com/yaccz))**

# reproducer:

```
virtualenv-3.2 venv
. venv/bin/activate
pip install sqlalchemy==0.7.9
pip install mako==0.7.0
pip install nose==1.1.2
cd alembic-0.4.2
python3.2 setup.py install
nosetests-3.2  
```

# output:

```
#! cat
======================================================================
ERROR: Failure: SyntaxError (invalid syntax (util.py, line 125))
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.2/site-packages/nose/failure.py", line 37, in runTest
    raise self.exc_class(self.exc_val).with_traceback(self.tb)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.2/site-packages/nose/loader.py", line 390, in loadTestsFromName
    addr.filename, addr.module)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.2/site-packages/nose/importer.py", line 39, in importFromPath
    return self.importFromDir(dir_path, fqname)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.2/site-packages/nose/importer.py", line 86, in importFromDir
    mod = load_module(part_fqname, fh, filename, desc)
  File "/home/yac/Downloads/alembic-0.4.2/alembic/__init__.py", line 8, in <module>
    from alembic import op
  File "/home/yac/Downloads/alembic-0.4.2/alembic/op.py", line 1, in <module>
    from alembic.operations import Operations
  File "/home/yac/Downloads/alembic-0.4.2/alembic/operations.py", line 1, in <module>
    from alembic import util
  File "<string>", line None
SyntaxError: invalid syntax (util.py, line 125)

======================================================================
ERROR: Failure: SyntaxError (invalid syntax (__init__.py, line 56))
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.2/site-packages/nose/failure.py", line 37, in runTest
    raise self.exc_class(self.exc_val).with_traceback(self.tb)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.2/site-packages/nose/loader.py", line 390, in loadTestsFromName
    addr.filename, addr.module)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.2/site-packages/nose/importer.py", line 39, in importFromPath
    return self.importFromDir(dir_path, fqname)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.2/site-packages/nose/importer.py", line 86, in importFromDir
    mod = load_module(part_fqname, fh, filename, desc)
  File "<string>", line None
SyntaxError: invalid syntax (__init__.py, line 56)

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 2 tests in 0.005s

FAILED (errors=2)
```

# The problem

__init__.py:
 56         except ImportError, er1:

http://docs.python.org/3.0/whatsnew/3.0.html#changed-syntax 4th bullet
